OF5YGpz9VKsOIFiglNpkmQ.text: It was a bit of a shaky walk to get here from an early evening pub session but it was definitely worth the wobble.  It's definitely an interesting dining experience as it's kind of a hybrid between semi-fastish food with casual dining.  You first get a card when you arrive.  You walk up to the various stations and pick out the dishes you want (pizza, pasta etc.) and they give you an Applebee's like pager thing where they will bring you the food when it's ready.  I think I ordered a simple penne bolognese and it was delicious!

09pLVAGhPpdMTvg5V_aD0g.text: Loved Loved Loved this pizza, pasta, Italian concept restaurant across the street from our hotel, CitizenM. We had the bruschetta which was to die for, we should have ordered two! Pizza was really off the charts good too. Traditional Italian crunchy crust, I'd definitely go back and wish we had a location in San Francisco!

GaciHQ0G7PpzS_V8lhxiWg.text: Love the system they use here. You can tailor your food to how you like it then watch it being made before you.Large selection of both pasta and pizza, and all I've tried so far have been delicious. Disappointing desserts, wouldn't bother getting one.Can get very busy during peak times.

kpXPXl_XT2yC4BdTFvOsSA.text: Pizza was average, but they are open late, taking orders to 11:00. Very handy as I came here at 10:40 pm after watching Anthony & Cleopatra at Shakespeare's Globe. I was happy to see they were open after the 3 hour play. They also conveniently serve wine in 175 ml, 250 ml, and full bottle sizes. Read the descriptions carefully, though. Their Margharita pizza would be called a plain pizza in NY or LA.

ZyYk1j9PL1xFZqrXlfm4FA.text: Great concept with the internal credit cards and fresh herbs on the table. Pizza and beer was really great with little time waiting for the food. Dessert could have been better though.

XZDJWbeTm17i1_oVvmdK8w.text: Great place to eat lunch. Fresh pasta and pizza. Gets a little crowded, but its to be expected.

AbJwPDj6xSZC8LSinUEEvw.text: Great clean fresh restaurant with friendly & helpful staff, food is cook fresh in front of you & the pizza's are divine! The same excellent experience on every visit.In a group, dont worry about splitting the bill you charge to individual acounts and pay on your way out so ideal for a work/student lunch when your all on different budgets.

BMG7D2ZUQd1tUbsLsOSZdg.text: I was fortunate to stumble across Vapiano last weekend while returning from a fruitless visit to "The Table" nearby (it had closed by then). Vapiano is a German restaurant serving Italian food. It ranks somewhere between a fast food place and a proper sit down restaurant. There is no waiter service here. When you enter, you would be given an electronic card. There are a number of counters serving various food items ... Some for pizzas, some for pastas, some for the drinks and so on. The customer would have to walk up to the relevant counter and order the food there, watch it being prepared in front of him/her and then take it back to the table. While at the counter, you would have to touch the card to a sensor on the ordering machine which would then record the item that you would have bought. The card has to be presented at the cash counter on the way out, and paid for. Since this was my first visit here, I went for a somewhat conservative meal choice. I started with some roasted veal slices. It had quite a bit of meat, cooked pretty well. But it seemed somewhat dry to me. The accompanying sauce was great on its own, but it didn't add much to the dish in my opinion. As the main course, I tried the carbonara pasta (with penne). It came with bacon, onions and egg, and was served with Parmesan cheese.  I will admit that it was one of the best pastas that I have had in a very long time. The cream tasted very good. The sauce mixed very well with the pasta base and hence the taste appeared uniform throughout the dish. The fried bacons were excellent, but I am forced to say that I would have loved a vegetarian version too, something that most people who know me would find surprising. The prices weren't steep. A starter, a main course and a small glass of white wine set me back by about £18. The service was quite quick and the ability to see the items being cooked was an additional bonus. I would love to eat here again.

AuLY07J9sM6F55Tx2RJlLg.text: ambiance on point. loved being able to order exactly what i want and watch it be prepared fresh in front of me. service was sub par- twas struggle to get service despite the # of ppl behind the counters. salad had no dressing....basically a cup of leaves. pasta on point, extra cheese also on point, zabiha chicken on extra point.

kvONw8wq1e9zjs2GR-0TjA.text: Somewhat bizarre experience the first time you go. As others have posted, you get an electronic card to which you charge your food and drink, and then are left to roam, ordering food from counters, and hoping for somewhere to sit and eat it. Nobody explains the concept when you go in, you're expected to know how it works. Food perfectly reasonable and I had some nice red wine to go with it. One of my colleagues was taken very ill after eating the seafood though. Go for the experience, but don't expect a relaxed meal and dinner conversation. It's a production line, they want you in, fed, and out again as quickly as possible.

uShnokkXTwjQSCBoAsgkrg.text: Great fast food!At this restaurant you have to go up to the counter and order and you food is literally made in front of your eyes! The pasta is tossed in front of you and if you order a pizza you are given a buzzer to tell you when to collect (usually in a matter of minutes).The pizza is really great, thin and crispy! The pasta looked pretty good too and the portions are pretty big.I went on a very busy lunch time and the service was excellent! All super friendly despite being crazy busy.Highly recommend!

6W5ajF6dmmGqSLKr1Z6m2Q.text: Love the crayfish pasta! Free bread available! you can imaging on Saturday night, it was freezing cold. girls want to sit together keep warm of themselves and have something special (but not too much on calorie)  Vapiano would be the best place i known and it never disappointed me ever!

4YP32JUPh94f7T0HBluNNQ.text: On the Continent, you cannot go wrong with Vapiano, the same applies to Vapiano Southwark. The restaurant definitely meets the high standards of Italian cuisine established by its franchiser. Excellent food, freshly prepared in front of your eyes - and you choose most of the ingredients, spices and even the sort of pasta yourself (try the whole grain spaghetti!). And the pizzas have such a crunchy crust, you must love them. One remark on the (sometimes criticised) credit card system: If my 64-year-old mum (a Vapiano fan) can handle it, why should hip Londoners struggle?

-n_beuzQuajaezPD2PyQvA.text: Great place, first we tried during our trip to London. You can mix any pasta you want - all cooked in front of you. The chefs can accommodate any taste. Kids portions go half-size, half-price, which is much appreciated. First time we got to this place, there was a line for pasta as only two of six or so pasta stations were open. It was fixed fairly quickly with two more chiefs joining. Overall, nice experience!

jzQir5lEXozJBarRjdqzZg.text: Best pizza I've ever had in London.A bit confusing to understand the whole set up of an "oyster card," and buying food with it and then paying the bill when you check out, but the food was so fantastic it's worth the effort.

-oTWfWelUQSDKhnN1Gxlsg.text: Amazing food. Good atmosphere. Uses a card system where you charge food to your own personal vapiano card, then pay at the end. You also have go up to the kitchen yourself to order and collect food/drinks (although helpful and polite  waiters are around). Together, the two points above mean it's a fun place to go in a group, but a little weird if it's just two people. Kitchen staff were a little rude, but again, the food is amazing!

XXqod4OP573w9z7G94rL6w.text: Speedy service, clean, clean clean clean. Very friendly staff. Foods nice if you fancy italian, menu's a bit limited and the deserts are a bit plain but overall good experience

dGpMjjOLX1Sgc7BDJ8Uo7w.text: German fast-food concept restaurant Vapiano recently opened its second London branch on the vibrant South Bank near the Tate Modern, bringing a new way of doing lunch to the area. Vapiano's big difference is that instead of being presented with a bill at the end of your meal which you need to waste time calculating if there's several of you eating, you're given a card similar to an Oyster card when you enter, and each time you approach a counter to order, you tap the card on a machine and it adds the cost of the dish, and any drinks you order, and you just pay on the way out. The food is freshly cooked in front of you and you're in full control of what goes in and what stays out. The drawback is that you do have to queue at service counters to get your food, and then carry it back to your table. Because of this, there's no worry about leaving a service charge or a tip, but it can be annoying particularly if there are just two of you and one of you is left guarding the table at a busy period! The food is all very good, the pizzas are well made and the olives here are fantastic.

Jk6Wxy050TvTLp_0_oqzxA.text: I popped in here to get something for take-away.  The staff were great in explaining how everything works and it was fun to watch my pasta get freshly cooked and I could choose it exactly how I wanted.  But it took a good fifteen minutes to get a takeaway despite not being that busy and my food was beyond salty.  While I really like the concept, it needs some more work.  I might be back to try their pizzas.

KUwedCLsF81WxHV6CT0cVQ.text: This is one of our pay day lunch eateries. If you're after good, fresh, tasty pasta this is the place for you! It's a little confusing the first time you visit as they give you a credit size card to load what you ordered onto which you then pay off at the end, there are lots of stations you queue at for pizza or pasta and then you choose the type of pasta you want, what flavours you want and then if you want chilli and garlic added, cheese on top and free slices of ciabatta. Once you've been once it's really simple! They cook the pasta in front of you whilst you wait. It's pretty quick once you get to the front of the queue but means it's really fresh. Today I went for the campanelli pasta (why have penne or fusilli you often have at home when there's other shapes?!) with bolognese, extra garlic and chilli, cheese on top and bread on the side. My colleague went for the scampi e spinachi with fusilli pasta...which she always goes for as it's apparently very good!I've never had pizza here so not sure what it's like but I definitely recommend the pasta. It's very busy at lunch time and it's not 'fast food' but it's tasty, large portions and reasonable value for money. They also do take away and the boxes the pasta comes in to take out is brilliant for re-using (it's large and very sturdy to keep washing and re-using!).Do pay a visit if you're hungry and passing a Vapiano.

j1Oi5ZSvLAz3_9zVODB1Ug.text: There are two type of people in the world: those who cant't extrapolate...Anyway, last night, I was almost passing out from hunger after a particularly hardcore running session in the gym followed by a trip to my estate agent (more on that, later), when I somehow stumbled across Vapiano on Southark Street.The venue looks quite nice, loads of rustic wood and, actually my favourite thing about it, little plants on each of the tables - rather pleasant.My idea of having a salad went out the window when I saw the pizzas and decided, well my stomach decided, that I had to have one.Vapiano is a 'fast-food' restaurant where you go to each the various pasta/pizza/antipasti counters and order, take the red vibrating thingy (wey-hey!!) and then patienty(!) wait for it to start vibrating.I didnt really like this method of service because, it kinda reminded me of being at the school/work canteen and also a bit like a cruise ship - basically, anything canteen-y.When my pizza arrived, it was however, tasty though a little subdued on the toppings' flavours, though I did like the sauce and the fact that my slices didnt fall apart when I picked them (none of the cutlery stuff for an animal like me).They have a bar waaaay round the corner which has some good beers (hmmm...beer), and I would say the whole place is reasonably priced.So why only three stars? I dont know, just seems right to me, I mean, it's 'A-ok'.

0Bw9LIe8ZREmDLpmQ5VdXA.text: Vapiano is a sort of twist on the Mongolian Barbecue concept with set choices. When you arrive you are given contactless cards on which you accrue what you've spent as you go to various stations to order pizza, pasta, salad and drinks.You choose where you sit and we had to hunt around for a couple of places being it was a Saturday night.We came for pizzas and chose of the menu.Ordering which was quick and simple and you're given a pager which goes off when your order is ready. Salad had to be ordered from another station which was mixed and dressed fresh in front of you while you wait.Sitting down allowed my partner to go get some drinks.The Pizzas were above good and the salad was plentiful.The Pasta dishes seems to be the favourite amongst the many who were there with a range of fresh pasta's to chose from and sauces. The portions looks plentiful.If you simply want to eat out and chill in good company this possibly isn't the place for you but some of you will love the interactive concept and watching your dishes being made fresh in front of you albeit you standing around.

hfyk_8hhlIGVovJDKjLUSw.text: This is a fairly good place, with regards to food. Great, open space and the whole ordering process is quite interesting.I'd also say it's quite expensive, just like everything else in London, for the services it provides. We ordered the pizza with the fig and it was marvelous, cooked to perfection.My penne with tomato and mozzarella just weren't up to par- a bit tasteless.The ambiance did help though:)Will keep in mind when wanting a quick dinner nearby.

9ApH824weWrWm_9KggjJbw.text: Quite possibly the worst pizza I've ever had. Stewed vegetables on toasted dough, it was how I imagine a microwaved frozen pizza would be. I've honestly had better at home, and you would almost certainly do better at any takeaway pizza joint. The card system they have in place to order and pay for it makes absolutely no sense whatsoever; I really don't understand what they're trying to achieve here. We eat out a lot, and this is the first review I've felt compelled to write. Says it all, right?

7rv9xx9vVVmf8OoD6tOSew.text: A return visit to this uber efficient italian quick serve. Arrived fairly tipsy and made a beeline for the bar. Suitably refreshed it was time for antipasti, then fresh pasta and a salad. All very tasty. I typically have pizza here but went for pasta this time, it was perfect. As I was dining with friends this was a great option as everyone gets to do their own thing, at their own pace, on their own card. I look forward to my next visit!

OwyUnnbIluhkuiVpR3Ebfw.text: Very delicious pizza, salads, and bread. I tried a friend's pasta dish and was equally impressed! The service was also uber impressive here. Definitely coming back on my next trip across the pond!!

d2DQhI5-5i9f-EvxXV2tCQ.text: although this place is far from fine dining, i think its really cool/fun concept!  What other restaurant allows you to have a conversation with your chef whilst he prepares your meal and makes suggestions/recommendations at the same time.  You can have variations of either salad, pizza or pasta and each has their own separate station/chefs.  I went to the pasta section and ordered the special with spicy tomato sauce and sun dried tomatoes.  You also get to chose what style of pasta you prefer (i.e wholewheat or spaghetti etc etc), and after making your selection, the chef takes a small brown bag from the back wall and empties your single serving of pasta into the boiling water before tossing it into the sauce/dressing which he has been preparing in another saucepan.All cooked in about 7 minutes and surprising tasty for the price paid.   This is a great casual restaurant to have in your rotation.

sLHT3kpzsdcexmKtvQfS_g.text: Absolutely love Vapiano - pasta cooked to wonderful al dente perfection every time! Their system is a bit different from most: upon coming in you receive a payment card. This will be scanned by your waiter when you order drinks, which are brought to your table. Once you have picked your meal, you go up to one of the counters (different ones for salad, pizza and pasta) where your food is prepared right in front of you and you need to scan your payment card again. You will always have the choice of adding chili, cheese and pine kernels - delicious! When you are done, take your payment card to the checkout counter, so no need to catch a waiters' attention. Plus, there are always gummy bears at the checkout - nice little treat. There are various pasta options for under £10 and there are usually three specials advertised at the counter which I often end up going for! I've never had a disappointing dish here and I always love coming back!

GDJcZHdmuICz8xnfpULkuA.text: Cooked to the way you like it and fun to figure out. The atmosphere is fun and the food is amazing.  I am only bummed that we found this place on our last night.

jiUb2OfFhgNjZq1iqmDDYA.text: This place surprised me.I've always held a dim view of franchise pasta restaurants: the food is almost always meh, charging exorbitant prices for boiled pieces of dough topped with non sequitur embellishments. Vapiano, actually, delivers yum.No one would argue that pasta is most delicious when prepared fresh but, on the other hand, I'm one to favor speed over quality: I don't wait for food, food waits for me (especially during lunch rush). No point banging on this - looks like freshness is a point of pride for the brand. Time wasted in queueing is what keeps me from visiting more often than I'd like.The cafeteria-esque format is attractive, as is the atmosphere and decor. The card based order tracking system is a pain in the ass.

S_QawYGPHm1NHrqO2_-RHA.text: Delicious food with exceptional efficiency. My favourite part is that when at the counter you can add whatever ingredients to your meal that is being prepared in front of you. It's free to add and makes the meal more filling for the same price. Non traditional Italian, the food lacks the classic Italian passion and it is obvious in the food. The service is non existent, you won't find that Italian warm welcome. However this modern twist makes it a great casual dining place, especially for groups since each can have their own card, removing the trouble of splitting the check.

cLxrKkH-oDSTr7PQI_3nfQ.text: It took a little bit to get the hang of the concept but it is rather clever. You scan a card at each station to indicate what you have ordered. Then you pay your total bill at the end on your way out. I had made-to-order pasta and it was very tasty, but I had a hard time understanding the gentleman preparing my food so it was a little awkward having to ask him to repeat himself over and over. But the ravioli was delicious! They also have pizza and salads and a bar. I'd give it another try now that I understand how it works.

tbSNlIG2Udj84vY17-s7EA.text: we got food poisoning from here. threw up the whole of the night and got minor fevers all the way through to the next day.horrible place..

_UbRbNQ5aa1tZnKuT3P9dg.text: Great concept for a restaurant. No reservations or tipping required and very affordable prices for fresh pasta.   Great fresh tasting Caesar salads.  Nice selection of wines by the glass. The mix and match pasta types and sauces make for and endless combination of pasta-billities. The Cognac sauce was excellent.

qvF59B8PcvEtTlAZXYGybA.text: This is one of my favourite places, very good pasta, pizza is delicious. Also they serve one of my favourite biers, Edingher. Must visit. Don't go to the Oxford street  branch.

Dd1ogcKSDodKyawnTdz-Og.text: I love this place. Cheap. Quick. Does takeaway. Cooked in front of you so you know it's clean. Perfection! Only problem is I keep getting cravings for it so I have to go there all the time. Oops.

8keGni65WEu0Bz3QPXKxMA.text: Being round the corner from where I live I have become had the chance to try various dishes from the menu. I can recommend the pizzas and pasta as being tasty and the quality of the ingredients excellent. The grand size of the space works well and never feels too big. All in all a good experience. Now where's the beef!?;)

F9Xmw7TSQQEaFjpG1aTGGQ.text: Can't get better fast food Italian. The price is great, the chefs are to be experienced.

9UuePZTN7rYrDGDKkrCRJw.text: I'll always come back to Vapiano's for the casual atmosphere, spacious seating, quick service, and of course, the incomparable Vapiano flavour. I always take advantage of the complimentary bread and pimp it with the basil plants and the chili oil on the table.When I lived in Germany, I was a regular at Vapiano's and almost always chose Pasta with Pesto but I recently tried the Aglio e Olio at the Southwark branch and loved that too.Apart from pasta, which is made fresh in house, they do pizzas and salads.There's also a bar and a range of Italian desserts is sold in glass jars.

SYLSQyrQ9iRY6Kg26CRfuw.text: The food is fantastic, the staff are friendly and its really affordable. plus depending on your plans you can be in and out in like 15 minutes or hours if you choose. relaxed and perfect for some good Italian, properly made.

cra-o725L1lmIXCxyyVSag.text: Vapiano is a bright and breezy open plan restaurant specialising in Italian food. There are no waiters, instead you get given a card and every time you want something you go to a station and they swipe your card. When you go to leave present your card at the desk. Simples! We kicked off with a grande plate of antipasti of Proscuitto tipo Parma, salami, pepperoni, roasted vegetables, homemade pesto, Grana Padano D.O.P, buffalo mozzarella, bruschetta (£10.95). Meat and cheese what's not to love?!They make their pasta fresh daily and they have a range of interesting specials. I chose the salssica con ficci £9.95, sausage with fresh figs, as it sounded unusual. I thought the pasta had a nice bite to it but unfortunately the delicate sweetness of the fig was overwhelmed by the spicy sausage. It was still tasty though and you do get a giant portion!More of the spicy sausage showed up on the next course of pizza. I was starting to get very full at this point so just took a tiny nibble. I knew dolci would be coming and I wanted to save space!I was wise to do so because then ALL the desserts arrived. Before you worry for our arteries we shared these between us. My favourites were the pannacotta £4.50 with a dramatic red top of coulis and the ciccholata foresta nera £4.50, an Italian take on black forest gateau but made with Nutella, which I am bound to love as it is my favourite spread in the whole wide world (speculous runs it a close second). Be warned most of the desserts feature cream heavily so if you are with a non dairy lover pick carefully. Luckily our resident non dairy fan Alex was adept at tunnelling through the cream to get to the chocolate underneath!

TFDFanB6zVWB9MXZk0ZB3w.text: GREAT PLACE. Great concept too. real low maintenance. They explain what is it upon walking in and they don't bother you again. I loved it. Great food also You watch them make it in front of you. Almost like a chipotle.

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Toscana Pizza
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Silsiccia Con Fichi

LJlyLF55bh4CChGMCrjskA.text: I've eaten in Vapiano a few times over the past year or two. Mainly as its round the corner from the london office and folk seem to like it. I actually remembered to take pictures this time and get around to reviewing it. This place is slightly confusing on entering. You get a credit card thrusted at you on entrance. Then you find multiple sections on pizza or pasta. Depending on what you want to order. You then aimlessly join one of the queues with the least folk in it, just to realise that's the slowest one!Pick your order, what pasta you want and any extras. Then it's freshly cooked for you. Simples as that!I went for a tomato pesto with pine nuts and chicken over linguine pasta. You get ciabatta bread thrown in for good measure. I had to wait around ten minutes, so this ain't no fly in and out lunch places. It is delicious though... But I always regret carbing it up like this at a lunchtime. I need an afternoon nap!!What does niggle me and why I won't give it five stars,.. it's disorganised chaos at  lunchtime. They really need to figure out a better method and implement it. That's why I don't make this my first choice for lunch. I simply don't have an hour to kill!Other times of day are okay and you really do need to try a pizza here. So light and crispy. Really darn tasty!!So all in all, waiting a while is its achilles heel, but if you have the time you won't regret it. You Gotta Eat Here - For Sure! :-D

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Chuckle with tomato pesto in pine nuts. Amazing!!!

kAhKTwjAVKhN29jhqDKmXw.text: For 10 quid, a steal. Popular with college students on a budget according to brother. I'm not a pasta fan, and find them generally uninspiring. However the pasta here was good enough and I might order it again.Pizza was excellent, thin crispy crust, extremely fresh ingredients. I liked the seafood and white shrimp pizza; well balanced, no one ingredient dominated. Try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. White shrimp or seafood pizza

JhgeFV5JbdTVAgY5DosKdA.text: I don't really care for the gimmicky style of ordering here: the diner is given a card and then goes up to one of the food stations to order. This would be less of an issue if the host/hostess explained the system upon arrival, but communication here is minimal. We were handed a card and basically left to our own devices, all the while wondering who would be taking our order. Eventually, we flagged down a staff member who explained the system to us, and at long last we were able to order some food. We got a pizza to share, which would have been great if the toppings weren't all set on one side of the pizza, and if we hadn't had practically to fight with the cook to get a second dish. All in all, not a fan of the concept, and it needs much better communication to actually work.

iljPmIJDuFh5qKlU40baGw.text: This was my first visit to a Vapiano restaurant. I love the concept of self-service cafeteria / canteen style dining! I suppose you do need to be watchful that someone else does not swap cards with you.

HCaLIdl56gU6WnGullOW3g.text: Vapiano is an open plan restaurant specialising in Italian food. There are no waiters, instead you get given a card and every time you want something you go to a station and they swipe your card. When you go to leave present your card at the desk.They make fresh pasta daily and they have a range of interesting specials. I chose the salssica con ficci (£9.95), sausage with fresh figs, as I wanted to see what this combination would be like ; it was pleasant but the spiciness from the sausage and sauce did not let the sweet notes of the fig shine through. They also do a great veggie pizza of spinach and pesto.Rounded off the meal with a dessert of pannacotta (£4.50) with an eye-catching red top of coulis. The perfect end to the meal!

b5Wt-E1DQy6wuv_ID0q50Q.text: My virgin Vapiano experience was in Munich/Germany. My colleague and I had lunch there and she was so impressed by the efficiency of this operation, that she called it a great German success. (It's first location was in Hamburg, but funnily enough it was created by a group of US investors.)Anyways, in my opinion Vapiano is the epitome for combining fast food with relatively high quality food. The best way to explain it, is to explain how you order:Upon entering the restaurant, a hostess will hand out a card to you. Then you proceed to the various food stations: there's a station for salad, pizza, pasta & drinks. At each station you place your order and the cook will then prepare it right in front of you (except for the pizza, where they will hand you one of these buzzers that will tell you once your order is ready). The cook will also add the appropriate amount to your card and you may then proceed to one of the many tables. When you're done eating/drinking, you proceed to the check-out and pay what's been accumulated onto your card. Just to be clear: this is not a place for a romantic get-away, but it's a good place to go when you're hungry and want something reasonably healthy fast.

MAu4w-iAEcRIdNqCSGcRmw.text: Knackered and peckish after three rounds of go-karting in Bermondsey, the eight of us wanted good food and drink without hassles. And Vapiano delivered exactly what we were after!Dinner at Vapiano - one of my favourite fast casual concepts - meant I could get a spicy pasta with sun dried tomatoes and a small Caesar salad whilst my colleagues were queuing for pizza, carpaccio and their own pastas. Once we had our food we all met at a sturdy wooden farm table and ate together. Since everyone gets their own food here, there's no waiting for a server, or for a fellow diner who cannot decide. This is clutch when you're on the edge of hanger (hungry anger)!Vapiano is no culinary breakthrough but I've enjoyed every meal I've had here - from in London and Berlin to Munich and Washington, D.C.

ibQ7jgyzRQaLMRNIg3wYwg.text: Vapiano. The Italian run by Germans should be a tagline. Delicious Italian food with Germany engineered experience and efficiency.Upon entering you're given a card then you head to the counter you'd like to purchase from. These are split by food type, Pizza, Pasta and....I forget....ANYWAY...You choose what you want then your card is scanned and you're given a buzzer that will tell you when your food is ready. You choose a seat and bam, wait for your food to be cooked.I must admit I've only had the pizza here, but literally everything looks good. The pizzas have a nice thin crust with light toppings. You won't feel heavy or greasy after leaving. A nice touch is that there are fresh basil plants all over the place ready to pick and put on your food. Water is free from jugs at the drinks counter (but again you need to get it yourself, as there is no service here, however nor is there a service charge...great right?)Anyways, remember that card they scanned? Well that has a record of what you ate, and you pay with this at the till on leaving. Note the delicious german gummi sweets on leaving and take as many as possible without receiving a raised eyebrow :)A fantastic experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Pizza Special Aubegine, truffle shavings

__uy_xgtUaNdL4UCiVbJoQ.text: Don't even hesitate on making the decision to go here! Just do it! The food is so fresh and tasty. The drinks are amazing and refreshing. I ordered a white tea and elderflower mint drink and it was so good. The pasta is to die for. I had the pumpkin soup and pizza as well. Everything was great and the service was also awesome!

6vNipdr80yfzk2xsvQw4Lg.text: Good pizza. Line was too long for pasta and I just did not want to wait, but it sure looked good. Unique atmosphere and like the ordering flow...

ZCAOl9GVYjDE4fDYVJWE0A.text: The pasta here is really fresh as they make their own produce which reflects the great taste.There is a nice selection of pasta's and in many respects, a good thing. I had spaghetti with a different type of pasta rather than the usual norm of the long stringy pasta.The chefs cook in front of you which is a plus, as you can tell them to add or takeaway ingredients you dislike. This is an advantage to those who suffer from allergies. The waiting time for food varies as it is dependant on what you get. Expect to wait for 5-10 mins if a few people are ahead of you, again, they make everything fresh.The service is ok. I particularly like that the staff are friendly, and the chefs make an effort to talk/joke around with you.The place itself, is very modern and clean.The price is reasonable. I spent around £10 for pasta and a can of drink.The spaghetti I had was very tasty and I, for sure, will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. The pasta produce.
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Pizza.
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Freshly prepared.

3QCywCHnGWn_KwssM8xpuA.text: Yum food with clean and open eating environment ! They have plants on the table and you can eat those too! Haha dessert is great as well !

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom

TDDujhSgayMNMVVKy-Wa6g.text: As a general rule, I try to avoid Italian restaurants. There's nothing new there, it's difficult for a restaurant to do anything which is memorable and most of them are chain pizza or pasta venues. So when I was taken to Vapiano, I was very much skeptical that it would be any good.But my was I mistaken - on entering, the first thing I noticed were the indoor plants, high ceilings with lots of natural light coming in and large tables spaced generously apart. You're given a card onto which you charge all the food and drink you buy, which makes this place perfect for groups. And then there are all the chefs at each station, making the dishes right in front of you, with skill and ease.And the best bit - it tastes pretty great. I was hypnotised watching fresh pasta being made in a huge pasta-making machine, and then being stacked on a shelf ready to be cooked up. I opted for a spinach and scallops with tagliatelle, which was cooked and seasoned beautifully. Though the menu lacks imagination, what they do do, they seem to do well.The staff were all very friendly and helpful, and although they didn't serve Fanta, I thoroughly enjoyed the food and the experience, and for a chain restaurant, this was a good place to go out to. Also, jelly bears on your way out - oh yes.

2_c2AVncwTndsz8IlgtZMA.text: If you are looking for a good Italian restaurant for lunch or dinner make sure you check this one out. From their home made pasta they cook right in front of you to your exact specifications (fans of customisation will love this) to their delicious pizzas, this is definitely the place to visit. I definitely recommend the salami and ricotta pasta as well as the classic carbonara (which tastes like no other!).

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom

-GeoS87Jh7eGAdf2wqMmcg.text: Great casual atmosphere and yummy salad and pizza! An enjoyable and relaxing meal for a reasonable price. I definitely recommend this restaurant!!

vPdicnGNH92N9zgNMxmKyg.text: My second time visiting Vapianos and I enjoyed the experience very much. I had grilled king prawn pasta and it was absolutely delicious and very filling! On arrival, you are given a card. The card is used to add your order. It's pretty much self service where you go to the counter to personalise your meal and it is cooked in front of you. Easy, efficient and tasty what more could you ask for?

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom

jk_Do1gMRZ7cc-pD6HgL-Q.text: Good place for pasta as they are freshly cooked and can be catered to your own tastes (sauces, cheese, spices etc). But the sauce I chose was made too thick and spaghetti was bit undercooked. Interesting concept of the restaurant but makes things inefficient IMO. Tho the chefs have mad skills to get one dish ready in 5mins, that means you still have to wait 20mins if there are 4 ppl in front of you. Compared to standing in line, I prefer to wait sitting at the table. Also I don't wanna queue in lines again only to get a dessert after queuing for pasta or pizza

bD9MmwVWpV60XOpSpnOrqw.text: Overrated concept restaurant. You go around station to station collecting dishes and racking up a tab on a tap card that you settle later. Woe to you if you are hungry and need a meal quickly, it isn't happening here. Strike one: ordered a caesar salad and was told to come back in 5 minutes when the station was empty and deviod of pending ordersStrike two: took forever to order at the pasta station. Disorganized customers and employees. They were out of my first and second choicesStrike three: mediocre bordering completely awful takes. Soggy and oily tasteless pasta, soggy thin pizza. How can someone ruin pizza? Make the crust so thin it easily falls apart. Final blow: about a £30 tab Bonus: nice takeaway container and nice staff

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Caesar salad no chicken
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Prosciutto e funghi pizza
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Salame e ricotta con rucola

4gzHUwTjgOwEbf7f_seMGQ.text: Fun story guys. I had been craving spaghetti bolognese (hold the meat... so I guess just spaghetti with tomato sauce) for about a month. Sounds strange that I didn't just eat some stupid spaghetti, but whatever. On my lunch break I ran over to Vapiano and ordered their spelt spaghetti (they have multiple options of pasta, points!!!) with pomodoro sauce (hold the cheese, trying to be vegan)... and, it was probably the most delicious lunch I had eaten in months. Anyway, Vapiano is excellent. They make the food right in front of you, which is pretty badass, and they have a ton of options and will cater to your needs (no meat or cheese, no problemo!) There's plenty of seating at this location or you can take it to-go, like I did. Their bruschetta is also FANTASTIC! Be careful though, I'd never come at lunch time (12-2) because it's probs way too busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Pomodoro- chili, oil, tomato sauce, garlic, onions. With spelt spaghetti and tomato. This was heaven.

yTnYN_0IaVH7-GrliqTOzA.text: The was the first Vapiano's i've ever been to and it was the best experience!! Not sure why I've never been back in the US. Great service, super nice staff to make my pasta, delicious food!!

gOPiEN46BIQGk0b9EpMxog.text: We were headed for a play at "The Bunker" nearby & the place we wanted to eat at did not take bookings and had a 45 min - 1hr waiting line outside, which was how we ended up at vapiano.I'd heard about vapiano, but I'd never visited before because their menu is very carb heavy and not something I would choose on purpose.As soon as you enter vapiano, you are given a card for each member in your group. There are then separate counters for salads, pizzas, pasta / risotto, dessert & appetisers.You stand in line for each of your orders. Pasta & risotto is made as you wait, the salad counter asks you to come back in awhile & the pizza guys give you a buzzer for when your pizza is ready. You swipe your card at each counter that you order at & then submit your card on exit where they total your bill for paying. It's cafeteria style, yet not really cafeteria style. The system works when you are alone & only want to pick up from one counter. You pick up your order before you settle down, but if you want things from multiple counters - a salad + a pizza it's a bit of a bother.The salads were good. We had a spinach + strawberry salad that was interesting & a carpaccio where I was surprised to see thinly sliced raw mushrooms on it. I was initially sceptical, but it did work.My husband was very happy with his seafood risotto. They had the rice precooked and toss it with whatever accompaniments & sauces you order, so it didn't take too long once ordered.The pizza wasn't bad, but not worth it for someone on a minimal carb diet.The dessert had Nutella & chocolate & vanilla cream, so it was obviously very good - with ingredients like that, you can't go wrong.I wouldn't enter vapiano on purpose since I try to keep white flour to a minimum & the only option left is the salads (which are cold) There's no hot meal option other than pasta or pizza. But if you like pasta, then this is a good place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Salads & risotto

88qu07zCoN5o-rIx6x1-Sg.text: Excellent food. Very fresh. At the pizza counter, people don't care for vegetarian or meat pizza when they cut pizza even though they have green and red cutter for vegetarian and meat respectively. Ambience is good. Location is perfect.

ndsxiCd6dgoF6e_xqzGCUw.text: Great fresh made Italian food.   Have a pay with card system. Must keep both cards to pay.  Who knew.  Awesome food. Must eat here. Loved it. Customs made plain pasta with chicken for kids.

-_3ZjnzS1VANxQNyl4_CvA.text: Such an interesting concept here! You go in, you get a card, line up, and they make you your pasta in front of you. The card then gets loaded with the price, and you pay at the end of your meal. The food was good! It was a nice serving of pasta, and the chef cooking it was very nice. This is a great place to bring picky eaters because dishes can be customized easily.

Vb_sJ7iVv4iHJkoQepv3Yw.text: I've never eaten at this place, but I've collected food from here a few times. If you do go here, I hope you don't have the misfortune of being served by Joice. Wow, she is so rude and unfriendly. Served by her a few times. She never says hello. Never smiles. This evening I saw her speaking harshy, almost shouting at a delivery driver when he asked how long until the order is ready.I feel sorry for her if she's having problems at home, but she shouldn't take it out on the customers.

zhE8LPfv5To2uh1082pyNg.text: The Gamberetti was so delicious and prepared promptly. The complimentary bread on the side is a plus as well. I absolutely love this place and definitely recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Gamberetti and complimentary bread

s2Sa-7oo0vl8QxckfKCL3A.text: Great food and good service taking into account you do much of it yourself.  It is a cheek place with buzz and music a bit on the loud side but still allows descussions on your table.  More open and stylish than private and comfy.  Location is good, just a stonethrow away from Tate Modern.

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Enn einn flotti og svali staurinn sem vi forum a, ohtt a mla me essum.

v7LW9JrgW8TNaniAUzw4rA.text: This is the single worst restaurant I have ever been to in my life. The concept itself is ridiculous and inefficient, the staff were at best inattentive and at worst rude, and the food itself was actually inedible. Now, I'm normally the kind of person who won't go out of their way to write a review no matter which way I felt about the restaurant. On more than one occasion I've been given food that wasn't exactly what I've ordered and eaten it anyway. I'm not a fussy eater at all. I ordered a chicken alfredo with linguine pasta, something you'd think is so simple it couldn't possibly be bad. I had about three bites and couldn't finish it because I felt ill. How you could turn pasta into the texture of chewy glue is beyond my comprehension. I feel so brutally offended to have spent £9.50 on food I couldn't even stomach that my evening has been completely ruined. They get 1 star because their strawberry bellini was actually quite lovely but that's about the only good thing I can think of for this restaurant. Every other aspect earns no stars and a very strong recommendation to all other diners to avoid this place like the plague it is.

Cpw2-_tM1IEx2fzDOG8E8g.text: I would not recommend this place especially if you are looking for a quick bite after work. I went there at around 8 pm on a Wednesday and it was first of all, really packed. As you all know that the chef will cook in front of you so if there are 4 people in front of your, each might order two dishes for their friends even. The good thing is that these Chefs have mad skills. They can cook for two people at the same time. And say 5 mins per dish, that will already be a 20 min wait. I actually waited for 40 mins for a funghi bolognease. The past was overlooked and the sauce is way too spicy. I would have to give it a 2 star review.

Avu-SeepZ0mp8qjHO4fRzA.text: Oh, it's a chain. I didn't come all the way to London to eat in a chain, did I? Yes, yes I did..but not by intention. Jamie W. and I passed by this contemporary-looking place which seemed to me like an appropriate dining option close to the Tate Modern (photo: bit.ly/1jPnYbJ). It's right across the street from the citizenM Bankside where we were staying. And yes, that's part of a chain, too. So I was willing to overlook the commercial aspect of the venture and let ourselves be served. But wait, we need a "chip" card to order? Is this an ATM now? Is this the return of the Horn & Hardart Automat? No, we're told to go to the various food stations to order our food thus cutting out the need for a waitstaff (photo: bit.ly/RzCdGY). Really? But she worked hard for the money, so hard for it, honey.So it's sort of like a cafeteria but fancier. Why am I not surprised this is a concept based in Germany? No personal warmth, just efficiency, Mein Herr. Jamie and I both went to the pasta station since we weren't quite in the mood for pizza. You get your choice of noodle, so he went for his perennial choice, Pappardelle with Bolognese Sauce for £ 7.95 (photo: bit.ly/1iE3eir). I went for Pappardelle too but with Salsiccia con Ficci (Italian sausage with figs) for £ 9.95. Both were hearty portions and surprisingly tasty given the production-line approach taken here. We also split a £ 6.50 Insalata Cesare (Caesar salad to all you non-cosmopolitan types who love their chains). It was fine, fairly generic but fresh (photo: bit.ly/1l7XM95). Locals appear to like it, so why should this curmudgeonly tourist spoil their fun?FOOD - 3 stars...pretty good considering how the assembly line doesn't give much room for culinary flairAMBIANCE - 4 stars...spacious communal tables and an upscale modern veneerSERVICE - 3 stars...a bit on automatic pilot since they expect you to know the routineTOTAL - 3 stars...I'm just a link in a chain but I still had a solid, rib-sticking pasta meal

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Insalata Cesare
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Pappardelle Bolognese
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom. Order counter

wWmEUJQU7VODG0xGrbW8Fg.text: I seriously love this place in Southbank London.Fresh pasta dishes prepared in front of you - proper Italian style pizzas.Some might find the dining style to be odd. You have to carry around these cards where the chefs preparing your food add the totals to your account - and then you close out and pay upon exit. I don't mind it except your party will need to secure a table or dining area and send party members up to the chef  queues  to order the food - otherwise your group might be carrying around trays of food with nowhere to sit.The format and quality of the food for the value tho is outstanding. I only don't give 5 stars because the cocktails are lacking. If you want beer or wine fine - but order a cocktail and get ready to drink something a bit below what you would find at a mall restaurant bar.

CtRdpdhXXoCvQYuCP5a62A.text: This is a gem! Firstly, the concept of Vapiano is quite different from any restaurant. It's a self service restaurant. You are handed an empty card when you walk in and you have to find a seat. Then you walk over to one of their stations and give your order, watch the chef prepare your food in front of you, collect it and swipe the card so that your dish is registered. At the end, you give in your card at the counter and make the payment you've racked up.It's definitely an amazing idea. I like that we can watch the chefs at work which also means you can personalise your dish more easily (don't go crazy). It also means your food comes a lot quicker which anyone can appreciate. Sure, you have to be on your feet for a bit but it's all part of the experience! The food itself is executed with perfection. I always go for the crema di fungi which is creamy pasta with different sorts of mushrooms. The cream is rich but not so much so that its sickly and the pasta is always cooked just right. I've also heard great things about the gamberetti which is pasta with king prawns and tomato sauce. Now the clincher: you get free bread. There is a great selection of dips that goes with the bread and it ties your meal in together nicely. There are also little pots of basil around which you can tear off and put into your dish which is a quirky touch. As for the atmosphere, it's buzzing. It's always filled with a slightly younger crowd and large groups of students. So yes, it does get very crowded in the evenings and there was once we had to wander around for 40 minutes to find a seat. The waiters do chip in and help you out if they see you lost but they probably need a few more for it to be efficient. Regardless, it's still a personal favourite on my list of restaurants. Top range Italian food for average prices.

EmQKc-_el1MoKd5qrTw1XA.text: Fast fresh Italian food, yes. I should not like this, as we all know my feelings on restaurant chains, but to be fair, you cannot beat someone taking the ingredients you choose and cooking them in front of you. It is a theatre to watch and satisfying to taste. It is a weird feeling entering an establishment, being given a card to wonder around on your own to discover what you want. It's kinda self service but not. You have the pizza area and what seems to be the salad area. Then there is the pasta and risotto section where you choose your pasta type (or risotto), ingredients and sauce. This is genius. Sorry but it is. Not sure how qualified these Chefs are, but this is the third time I have been here and each time I have been in awe of their ability to cook up a pasta delight. Sometimes even doing two orders at a time. They ooze confidence and it shows in the finished product. During my most recent visit, Eleanor started with the bruschetta duo (roasted ciabatta bread, basil pesto, tomato and grana padano) and also a salad of Chicken, croutons, romaine and grana padano D.O.P. I went straight in on the carbs with pasta, king prawn, basil pesto, cherry tomato, spinach, onions and cream sauce. For main course, Eleanor went with chicken salad. So you order what you want and you swipe your card for it to record it. You can also go to the bar area to order drinks. I am not sure how the other venues are, but the one at Bankside is very organised. Each time I have been here, I have found a clean spot to chillax and eat. There is a large eating area just outside on Southwark Street, so in the summer months, you can take advantage of the rays. I like this spot. It is good spot for a quick lunch or dinner. Of course, if you want the best authentic Italian experience, there are places which you have to go. That said, Vapiano is a good contender as long as they stay true to the fresh ingredients and professional prep I have had the pleasure of enjoying on the last three occasions.

SY0qRcLM6ztwaHXzK904MA.text: Worse thing, ever!!! After giving me a wrong pizza and insisting that it is vegetarian pizza. I was about to take it to his manager that pizza guy realized that he gave me a wrong pizza. He ran back to get the correct, cold pizza!!! We are never going back... Wasted my $$

photos.caption: Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Vapiano - London, United Kingdom

BW-Cz2IvPTNDKp-ZV8QgYA.text: Vapianos is one of my favourite regular haunts. The food's reasonably priced and prepared speedily; watching the chef prepare your dinner and alter it to your specifications never gets old; I like the relaxed sit-anywhere approach; and the paycard system is a great fix for debating how to split the bill when you go out with a group.The being said, this visit didn't get off to the best of starts as it took me a few attempts to get the message across about wanting crayfish swapped out of my risotto for chicken. Once that hitch was fixed, though, my food was soon ready. Has to be the best risotto I've eaten too, or at least up there: white wine risotto with chicken, white asparagus and onion. Not the kind of place I'd go for a special occasion, but great for relaxed comfort food.

pDhU9Fs1N-F5SVW2fXhfsQ.text: I have only been to Vapianos a couple of times but I can say that I really enjoyed not only the food but the whole concept of the restaurant.I have had pizza and pasta dishes and both were extremely good and tasty.The pizzas are pretty much set on a menu with options to add more toppings but when ordering pasta it is completely customisable. You can choose one of the recipes on offer, customise it with additional ingredients or taking some out and can customise with whatever pasta you want, all freshly prepared right in front of you.Affordable, packed full of flavour and friendly service with a smile makes Vapianos a place to try if in the area.
